trans-unit.source: Contains a read-only collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone"></xref> controls.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> class contains the collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone> controls that exist on a Web Parts page.
It is used primarily by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control to track and manage all the zones.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control keeps a reference to the collection of zones on a page in its read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.Zones%2A> property.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> class is useful when you want to carry out operations on multiple zones or their contents at the same time, or when you need to locate a particular zone and examine or change its contents.

Although the collection of zones itself is read-only and you cannot change the size of the collection object itself, you can still get references to the individual zones within the collection, and when you have a reference to an individual zone object, you can change its property values.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> class has two constructors.
The first one, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.%23ctor>, simply initializes an empty instance of a new <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection>.
The second one, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.%23ctor%28System.Collections.ICollection%29>, initializes a collection by passing in an existing collection of zones.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> class contains an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.Item%2A> property.
This property allows you to locate a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone> control within the collection by passing in a string identifier.
The zone is located by matching the string identifier to the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Control.ID%2A> property on a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> zone.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> class also has several methods that are useful for examining or accessing its contents.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.Contains%2A> method determines whether a particular zone exists in the collection.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.CopyTo%2A> method copies the collection to an array of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase> objects.
Finally, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.IndexOf%2A> method returns the index of a particular zone within the collection.
Initializes an empty instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager> control uses this constructor within its own constructor to initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> class for a Web Parts page.

Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection"></xref> class by passing in a collection of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone"></xref> objects.

Use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.%23ctor%2A> constructor when you want to create a custom collection of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone> objects to carry out programmatic operations on them.

For example, you could access the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManager.Zones%2A> property and create a subset of <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone> objects on a Web Parts page, assigning them to a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> object, and then carry out operations on the child controls or various properties of only that subset of zones.
An <xref href="System.Collections.ICollection"></xref> of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone"></xref> objects.
The collection of zones is `null`.
One of the objects in the collection is `null` or is not of type <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone"></xref>.
Returns a value indicating whether a particular zone exists in the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.Contains%2A> method enables you to check a particular <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone> object and determine whether it is in a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone"></xref> that is checked to determine whether it is in the collection.
A Boolean value that indicates whether a particular zone is in the collection.
Copies the collection to an array of <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase"></xref> objects.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.CopyTo%2A> method is useful when you want to create a custom array that can contain the zones in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> collection, a subset of those zones, or a superset of those zones.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase"></xref> array to contain the copied collection.
The starting point in the array at which to place the collection contents.
Returns the position of a particular member of the collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.IndexOf%2A> method is useful if you have multiple <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone> zones on a Web Parts page, and you need to know the ordinal position of one zone relative to the other zones.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneBase"></xref> that is a member of the collection.
An integer that indicates the position of a particular object in the collection.
Returns a specific member of the collection by passing in an integer.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.Item%2A> property enables you to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone> object within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> collection by using an index number that represents its ordinal position in the collection.
The index number for a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone"></xref> within a collection.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone"></xref> at the specified index in the collection.
Returns a specific member of the collection by passing in a unique identifier.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection.Item%2A> property enables you to access a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone> object within a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZoneCollection> collection by using a string identifier for a particular zone.
All matching on string identifiers is case-insensitive.
The unique identifier for a particular <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartZone"></xref> within the collection.
The first in the collection whose ID equals the value of id.
